archive_path.description: The path in the downloaded archive where the binary is located. Default is ./<bin>

bin.description: The name of the binary to be installed. Default is the name of the dependency.

link.description: Whether to create a symlink to the bin instead of copying it.

overrides.description: Overrides allows you to override values depending on the os and architecture of the target system.

required_vars.description: A list of variables that must be present for an install to succeed

substitutions.description: Substitutions will substitute values from vars.

systems.description: List of systems this dependency is known to support

template.description: A template for this dependency. Any unset fields in this dependency will be set by values from the template. Overrides in the dependency and its template are concatinated with the template's overrides coming first. Vars and substitutions are both combined with the dependency's value taking precedence.

url.description: The url to download a dependency from.

vars.description:
A list of variables that can be used in 'url', 'archive_path' and 'bin'.
Two variables are always added based on the current environment: 'os' and 'arch'. Those are the operating system and architecture as defined by go's GOOS and GOARCH variables. I should document what those are somewhere.
You can reference a variable using golang template syntax. For example, you could have a url set to `https://example.org/mydependency/v{{.version}}/mydependency-{{.os}}-{{.arch}}.tar.gz`.  If you define the var 'version: 1.2.3' and run bindown on a 64 bit Linux system, it will download `https://example.org/mydependency/v1.2.3/mydependency-linux-amd64.tar.gz`.

dependency.description: Values to override the parent dependency

matcher.description: Describes which systems this override applies to

arch.description: List of architectures to match. When left empty, all architectures match.

os.description: List of operating systems to match. When left empty, all operating systems match.

additionalProperties.description: List of values to match. Any matching value will match. If a value can be interpreted as a SemVer, it will be treated as such.

vars.description: Variables to match. All variables defines in the matcher must match the dependency.

cache.description: The directory where bindown will cache downloads and extracted files. This is relative to the directory where the configuration file resides. cache paths should always use / as a delimiter even on Windows or other operating systems where the native delimiter isn't /.

dependencies.description: Dependencies available for bindown to install.

install_directory.description: The directory that bindown installs files to. This is relative to the directory where the configuration file resides. install_directory paths should always use / as a delimiter even on Windows or other operating systems where the native delimiter isn't /.

systems.description: list of systems dependencies should support

templates.description: Templates that can be used by dependencies in this file.
